div1.p: Phillips encourages Carter to keep his money in Peruvian pounds due to the poor exchange rate.

Dear Sir:
div1.p:
We have received your letter of July the 19th,
referring to your deposit of £p.1,000.- You are quite
right in saying that the exchange is even lower than
when this deposit was made. Unless you are in need of
the money we recommend even more strongly than before
that you leave this deposit here in Peruvianpounds,
being unquestionable that the rise in exchange will amount
to a great deal more than 4% per annum. To day's rate is
dollars 3.25 cents to the Peruvian Pound.
div1.closer:
With very best regards, we are,
Yours very truly, BANCO MERCANTIL AMERICANO DEL PERU.
LM Phillips Assistant Manager. COPIADO
LMP/CC.
